title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.3: EMERGENCY NFI

description.narrative: Children are protected from weather hazards through essential winter kits and blankets, which contributes to Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Social and economic vulnerabilities of disadvantaged children and their families are identified and addressed.

sector.narrative: Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Support to other social protection programs - Universal health coverage/health insurance

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children are protected from weather hazards through essential winter kits and blankets

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF expanded its Basic Need Support programme reaching over 525,000 children (53% girls, 47% boys) in eleven governorates with seasonal clothes, blanket and e-vouchers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of girls and boys protected from extreme weather through provision of NFIs
Number of girls and boys provided with Cash Transfers for Basic Needs Support.
